intro: Oxypetalum insigne var. boraceiense, commonly known as the Boraceiense bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or alpine settings. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
